intro: Odontocarya echinus, commonly known as the spiny spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Odontocarya echinus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
